title: Tesla Is Allegedly Withholding Wages from Sick Workers in Germany
description: German workers enjoy some of the most robust protections of any country in the world. Tesla, an American company with a factory near Berlin, has seen protests and other disruptions in its German operations, and it’s now facing allegations that it withheld pay from sick workers and pressured them to disclose their private medical information.
author: Chris Teague

text: Theory Z is what we have in reality: When left on their own, a portion of the workforce, call them Group A, is happy and productive. Others, Group B, must be constantly monitored to ensure they perform some semblance of work. Because feelings are hurt if logic is applied and Group B are called what they are, unproductive slackers, Group A must take up the slack created by Group B. When Group B is finally held to the same standard as Group A, incessant whining ensues. Seeing as how little has been proven either way, I will refrain from assigning these German workers to Group B. But seeing as how slanted everything is against the once messiah Musk these days, I'll take the accusations against Tesla with a grain of salt.
